Title: Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second
What Youll Do: Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with. Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices. Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting. Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals. Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization. Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap. Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.
We Are a Match Because You Have:
 6+ years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc). Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems. Experience building web services with Java, REST, Micro-services. Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.). Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g.Docker, Kubernetes, etc). Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis. Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

The Growth marketing team owns full-funnel marketing for Wayfair EU and is looking for a marketing analyst who will take responsibility for driving the execution of our Paid Display and App Marketing programs in Europe. We drive the ultimate growth and revenue strategy for the business by partnering with Data Science, Martech, Product and other internal and external teams to build innovative platforms and systems to provide our customers with a smarter, unforgettable, personalized, and world-class experience. 
What You'll Do


Be responsible for a portfolio of Paid Display and App paid marketing campaigns that span across the funnel

Analyze and monitor campaign performance, identify trends, and make optimizations to drive ROI; react to deviations from plans quickly and strategically.

You will be managing a multi million dollar monthly advertising budget. Your goal is to grow our customer base and maximize customer lifetime value to drive long-term profit

Bachelor degree (or higher) in a quantitative field of study: math, sciences, economics, or business. Or qualified by experience

Excellent critical thinking and stakeholder management skills - ability to break down and communicate complex ideas and influence senior leaders and cross-functional partners

Prior experience in digital marketing, management consulting, startup/tech, finance, and/or strategy with an analytical emphasis is highly valued

RoleDescription:
Location: Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Job Title: Machine Learning Scientist I
Who we are
Wayfair is an online retail platform with the mission to enable everyone to live in a home they love.  To do this Wayfair builds and leverages cutting edge Machine Learning and AI products and we are looking for talented individuals to join us. Wayfairs Search, Marketing, and Recommendations ML teams build algorithmic systems that drive our business, enhance customer experience, and improve customer loyalty powering what our customers see on and off our site at web scale. What youll do

Design, build, deploy and refine large-scale machine learning/AI models and algorithmic decision-making systems that solve real-world problems for customers

Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts, and overall bias towards simplicity and efficiency
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm about continuous learning

Some prior experience or a high-level understanding of search, recommendations and ranking in an e-commerce setting would be a strong plus.
Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML) experience or Java experience

Job Title: Machine Learning Scientist II, Predictive Search & Guidance

Wayfair is moving the world so that anyone can live in a home they love  a journey enabled by more than 3,000 Wayfair engineers and a data-centric culture. The Search, Marketing, and Recommendations technology science team (SMART) builds and owns all the Machine learning (ML) products that power all search, marketing, and recommendations technology across Wayfair. Our algorithms tackle a varied & broad spectrum of challenges in the Wayfair marketplace; from empowering suppliers to easily add products to our catalog, to enabling our customers to discover and purchase a vast & diverse assortment of home goods, to driving marketing experiences customers love all at web scale.

Be obsessed with the customer and maintain a customer-centric lens in how we frame, approach, and ultimately solve every problem we work on.

Solid understanding of algorithms for search ranking, relevance, NLP, or recommender systems.

Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production


Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm about continuous learning.

 
Nice to have

Experience in e-commerce, or online search systems.
Knowledge of modern NLP techniques (transformers, embeddings, semantic search).
Experience applying Generative AI / LLMs (e.g., GPT, LLaMA) to real-world problems such as search, personalization, or content generation.
Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch.
Familiarity with vector databases, information retrieval frameworks (e.g., Elasticsearch, Vespa)
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), ML model development frameworks, ML orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow)
Experience with Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML).

Title: Data Scientist II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Data Scientist III, SCRT Data Science
Bengaluru, India TDC
 
The Supply Chain Retail Technology Data Science team is dedicated to understanding and optimizing user interactions with our Supply Chain & Retail Technology suite of tools and products. SCRT Data Science is responsible for integrating analytics into the DNA of these growing tech teams, unlocking the insights that will guide the business in our quest for cost-efficient, perfect orders, at scale, with AI and data science techniques playing a crucial role in processing vast datasets and predicting optimal outcomes. We bring a multidisciplinary blend of analytical aptitude, technical expertise, business strategy, and stakeholder management. Own the insights that inform the SCRT product roadmap, including driving outcomes within Fulfillment, Transportation and Service Technology.

Collaborate with all facets of the organization including product management, engineering, and creative design to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making.

Experience with experimental test design (e.g., A/B testing; Multivariate and Multi-Armed Bandit) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making.

5+ years work experience in relevant field

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
The Data Engineering team within the GST fulfills large-scale data needs for its data scientists, machine learning and analytics covering both batch and real-time use-cases. Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models, data pipelines, and data products focussed on Search and Recommendations.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Title: Tech Recruiter, Early Careers, Contract
RoleDescription:
The base pay for this position is $31- $35 per hour. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
This position is full time and is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA. This role is not a virtual / remote position - 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
This is an entry level recruiter role and is a contract position with potential to convert to a permanent position based on business needs.
The Wayfair Campus and Early Careers team is strategic to the company's overall success and continued growth. Our recruiters are true business partners and charged with finding, attracting, and hiring top talent into entry level roles across all parts of the company against a high bar for performance, potential, and culture.
This is your opportunity to join the new Early Careers Recruiting team under the broader Wayfair Campus & Early Careers department! This role is perfect for the recruiter who is energized by the ever-changing landscape of attracting early career talent and hyper-focused with providing an impeccable candidate-experience. 
This role will focus on acquiring top talent in the early stages of their career (upcoming and recent graduates with up to 3 years of experience) and placing them into high priority roles within the organization. You will play a major role in growing Wayfairs brand and making this the place to be to kickstart careers. This role will partner closely with recruiters across our Talent organization to meet the fluctuating entry level needs of our hiring managers based on business priorities, attrition, and campus recruiting seasonality. This person will need to have working knowledge of Gen Z and candidate trends, and be able to translate these into strong recruitment strategies.
You may be a great match for this opportunity if you have an exceptional communication style coupled with an operational mindset that enables you to excel in the high-volume recruiting arena and the want to constantly be looking to learn, grow, and develop in your career. You should be comfortable with remaining agile and thrive in an ever-changing role and environment. 
What You'll Do

Full-cycle recruitment from attraction to onboarding, including: job posting, event planning and management, sourcing, interviewing, and closing candidates.
Proactively build a consistent pipeline of applicants for a variety of roles to meet the real-time hiring needs of the business.
Ensure an impressive, high-touch candidate experience from initial contact to offer decisions and sell strategy, including providing feedback to candidates throughout the interview process.
Partner with senior level stakeholders to deliver a best-in-class recruitment, interviewing, and hiring experience. 
Work to improve existing processes and develop innovative approaches for securing future talent.
Uphold an inclusive recruitment process in alignment with Wayfairs People Principles and commitment to DEI.
Manage and facilitate recruiting activities with external partners, including networking events and presentations to attract a high caliber and quantity of applicants.
Flex to support Wayfairs Summer Internship Program planning, in addition to various campus events and programs throughout the year, as needed #OneTeam.

What You'll Need

1+ years of experience in full cycle recruiting in a high-growth and fast-paced environment within campus, university, higher education, career services, or related high volume recruiting spaces.
Experience in recruiting for Tech positions (SWE, Machine Learning, Data Science), Commercial, Operations, or Finance positions is a plus.
Ability to manage strategic relationships with senior level stakeholder and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
In-depth direct sourcing expertise utilizing a range of methods and sources and experience promoting a compelling employment brand internally and externally.
A strong interest in emerging technology and the ability to integrate generative AI tools (e.g. Gemini) into daily recruiting tasks to drive efficiencies.
Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands.
Experience establishing relationships with external partners such as campus career centers & promoting a compelling employment brand.
Proven record of finding efficiencies in your work without compromising the business relationship or candidate experience, with a comfortability to flex outside of your job duties to support the broader talent acquisition team.

The Team & The Role
The Fintech & Loyalty (F&L) organization builds and manages the foundational systems, financial products, and fraud detection and prevention services that provide customers with a secure, seamless, and rewarding payment experience. 
F&L partners with 30+ organizations worldwide to provide a robust selection of gifting, paying, and financing options, to securely process $12B+ in annual transaction volume, and to detect, prevent, and mitigate fraud.
As the Senior Analyst for Payments & Fraud, you will play a critical role in optimizing our payment processing and protecting Wayfair from fraudulent activity. You will work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment, providing the analytical firepower and partnership management needed to execute our strategy. You will report to the Manager of Payments & Fraud and collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, Analytics, and Finance to drive tangible results.
What You'll Do


Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) across both payments and fraud, including authorization rates, payment costs, chargeback rates, and fraud false positives. In addition to curating meaningful reporting, you will translate your analytical insights into actionable recommendations and champion the initiatives needed to drive improvement

Support the day-to-day management of our strategic partnerships with payment processors, card networks, digital wallets, and fraud prevention vendors. This includes helping to lead performance reviews, ensuring invoice accuracy and holding partners accountable to contractual SLAs

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive initiatives that improve authorization rates, lower payment costs, and minimize fraud risk, all while protecting the customer experience

Assist in exploring new partnerships and technologies in the payments and fraud space. You'll support the team from technical diligence through to contract execution

Maintain a strong understanding of the payments and fraud landscape, synthesizing opportunities from market trends and competitive analysis to help shape our roadmap


What Youll Bring


Experience in the payments industry, preferably in fraud/risk, e-commerce, card payments, network brands, and / or acquiring

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for getting deep into the data. High proficiency in Excel is required. Experience with data visualization software (e.g., Looker, Tableau) is a plus

Comfort drawing conclusions and making recommendations from imperfect information. You can leverage data from multiple sources to tell a persuasive story

A demonstrated ability to help drive projects to completion across multiple teams in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to tailor your style to different audiences

Willingness to roll up your sleeves and engage deeply with analysts and managers, across multiple teams and agendas, to accomplish what needs to be done

Create processes or provide feedback on processes to most efficiently execute this work across both internal and external stakeholders.

RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.

At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
Who We Are
To win in the home goods space, Wayfair has to regularly make tactical decisions to influence revenue trends and improve the customer experience, and also needs to keep a tight pulse on progress along strategic goals. To inform these, we require a deep understanding of trends in internal performance indicators, customer health and competitive developments. Wayfairs Business Trends team is the C-suites right hand in steering revenue growth, monitoring performance drivers, and surfacing tactical and strategic opportunities in real time.
We are looking for a Senior Manager who will own the revenue performance narrative for Wayfairs North American business with a focus on wayfair.com, combining sharp analysis of input metrics with executive storytelling that shapes weekly leadership decisions. In this role, you will tightly partner with Commercial, Operations, and Technology leaders in understanding the impact of recipe input metrics (e.g. ship speed, availability or price levels) on revenue performance, surface and prioritize revenue improvement opportunities across both immediate and long-term horizons, and align on narratives which are shared in our weekly status report to the C-suite. You will also closely collaborate with the Head of CompIntel in understanding competitive trends driving revenue, the Head of Business Trends Advanced Insights in expanding the Business Trends toolkit and advancing use cases for GenAI / agentic AI, and with our Data Engineering team in improving our foundational data platform. This role reports to the Director of Business Trends & Competitive Intelligence.  
This role offers an opportunity to shape the revenue agenda of a Fortune 500 e-commerce leader, with visibility and impact at the highest levels of the company. The ideal candidate combines strong analytical acumen, an ability to tie different data inputs to a consistent narrative and strong cross-team collaboration to influence both short and long term revenue tactics. 
 
What You'll Do

Partner with the Director of Business Trends to craft a weekly C-suite update that drives decisions on short- and mid-term revenue priorities with a focus on wayfair.com. 
Collaborate with key leaders across Commercial (e.g. Pricing, Category Management, Marketing, Promotions), Operations (e.g. Logistics, Service) and Technology (e.g. in relation to site load speed or tech-driven site issues) in improving input metrics and forming a narrative on trends which flow into the weekly C-suite update.
Identify and analyze connections between wayfair.com, wayfair.ca, our SRBs (e.g. Birch Lane) and our luxury brand (Perigold), highlighting key similarities and differences in e.g. customer mix and seasonal approach.
Support the GM of wayfair.ca in understanding revenue drivers and making the connections to the US business. Ensure ongoing reporting cadence for the SRBs (e.g. Birch Lane) whilst staying fluent on key revenue trends across these stores. 
Build a 6-18 months roadmap outlining our plan to improve the positioning of Business Trends as the connective tissue across Commercial, Operations and Technology. This includes continuously improving our modeling of input metrics and macro factors to predict revenue performance. 
Collaborate with the Head of Business Trends Advanced Insights and the Head of CompIntel in advancing joint OKRs.  
Develop and maintain tracking of macroeconomic trends (e.g., housing market), ensuring external drivers are systematically factored into revenue performance analysis.
Oversee and refine dashboards and guide enhancements to predictive models that inform decision-making, ensuring analytical rigor while leveraging a global analyst team for execution.
Present findings confidently to senior stakeholders across the US and global business.
Act as the go-to expert for performance insights across the North American business with a focus on wayfair.com. 
Provide dotted-line leadership to a global analyst team, ensuring quality, consistency, and scalability of dashboards and data foundations.

 
What You'll Need

5+ years experience in investment banking, M&A, corporate finance or private equity preferred.  
Bachelors degree with a focus on economics, math, statistics, engineering, business or related field is a plus
Exceptional communication skills, with proven experience presenting to senior executives or clients and shaping decisions through clear, data-driven narratives.
Ability to connect macroeconomic and competitive factors with internal performance drivers to anticipate revenue shifts.
Proven ability to lead and mentor junior talent, ensuring analytical excellence and narrative consistency.
Proven track record in driving results along a set of key output metrics and OKRs.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact, and how Business Trends fits in.
Thrives in high-stakes, fast-paced environments; resilient, adaptable, and comfortable driving clarity from ambiguity.
Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; Experience with SQL or Google Big Query is a plus but not required.

As a Junior Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's/masters degree or qualified by experience
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.
